attributes.action: Arm the Rohingya who are facing ethnic cleansing in Myanmar
attributes.background:
The Rohingya are the most persecuted ethnic minority group on Earth. Their villages are burnt to the ground by Burmese soldiers. Abuses include rape, killing civilians and burning villages.
 
The Rohingya need access to weapons to defend themselves and their families.
attributes.additional_details:
The Burmese military has committed harrowing atrocities against the Rohingya and we need to act in the same way that the international community acted when ISIS committed atrocities against the Kurds and Yazidis.
 
The UK should provide military and logistic assistance including arming Rohingya villagers so that they can sufficiently protect themselves against the rapists and killers.

attributes.action: Teach domestic abuse to all children in schools
attributes.background: As a single mother of 4 daughters, I have gone through domestic abuse and I am trying to bring my daughters up to know this is wrong, and as they spend a lot of time at school I think all children, girls and boys, would benefit from this being taught at school.
attributes.additional_details:
With domestic abuse on the rise we need to educate our children that this is wrong and not to put up with it. This is the only way to stop this moving on to the next generation. 

We also need to start making parents responsible for the actions of their abusive children. We are fined if our child misses too much school

attributes.action: Make keeping primates as pets a criminal offence
attributes.background: Primates are the closest animal to us. They are incredibly intelligent creatures with many needs that simply cannot be met in a domestic environment. We would, of course, love to believe that people with a licence to keep a pet monkey would be aware of these needs, but sadly most are not.

attributes.action: Stop mortgage interest support benefit changes.
attributes.background:
Next April the mortgage interest benefits support change to become a loan. This will make life even more difficult for the claimants relying on this benefit.

It means that more people could lose their homes, in turn needing to find rental properties and claiming housing benefits.

attributes.action: Tighten the regulations on who can give Botox
attributes.background:
At the moment anyone can administer Botox after it has been prescribed.
I think only medical professionals should be able to administer Botox into clients.
e.g. Doctors, surgeons, dentists and nurses.
attributes.additional_details:
I recently had a procedure done by an unqualified person who then left my face drooping down and paralysed.  I am one of many women who have suffered.  
Botox is a controlled substance this has to be prescribed by a doctor dentist or nurse prescriber.  At the moment who injects the Botox after this can be any one with no medical background. The dangers of this can be blindness , paralysed muscles and anaphylactic shock which can be fatal.

attributes.action: End the right of Anglican Bishops to have 26 seats in the House of Lords.
attributes.background: Although only 15% British citizens are practising Anglicans, and this falls to 3% for those under 24. This is a continuing trend, yet the UK parliament allows 26 unelected Anglican Bishops to sit in the House of Lords. This privileged, undemocratic, discriminatory, anachronism cannot continue.
attributes.additional_details: The right of Church of England Bishops to sit in the House of Lords is a tradition that continues from mediaeval times. The UK is the only parliament in the world that accords a unique privileged status to religious representatives. Known as 'Lords Spiritual' these 26 Church of England Bishops occupy a position of political power that is no longer relevant in a country where so few identify with the Anglican church. If Bishops wish to represent UK people, why should they not stand for election?

attributes.action: Make medicinal cannabis legal for long term mental/physical health conditions
attributes.background: I have had cerebral palsy since birth and suffer with chronic pain and stiffness every day causing a very limited life. Now being housebound, I would love your help to enjoy life and I believe medicinal cannabis (high cbd/low thc) could help control/relieve symptoms for many health conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Medical cannabis, or medical marijuana, is cannabis and cannabinoids that are recommended by doctors for their patients.The use of cannabis as a medicine has not been rigorously tested due to production restrictions and other governmental regulations. Evidence suggests cannabis can: reduce nausea and vomiting during chemotherapy, improve appetite in people with HIV/AIDS, help with anxiety/depression and reduce chronic pain and muscle spasms.

attributes.action: Air travellers: punish drunken and/or violent and/or threatening behaviour.
attributes.background: To apply within the confines of an airport, or on board an aircraft (especially where this threatens the safety of the aircraft, crew or passengers).  A mandatory 2-year ban from flying with any airline operating flights from the U.K., 5 years for a second offence, a life ban for any third offence.
attributes.additional_details: People arrested for drunkenness on planes has doubled in the last year.

attributes.action: Force the Government to fully fund the RNLI
attributes.background: in Britain we are one of the few countries that do not fund the Royal National lifeboat Association  and it is a scandal that we have to donate to something that should be provided as a government funded service.
attributes.additional_details: I was recently told by a lifeboat crew member that the service costs about ¬£160m a year to finance, this is a a tiny amount when you look at government spending on say consultants, why are we allowing this travesty to continue.

attributes.action: Agree to change the law to tag all potential terrorists.
attributes.background: Currently it takes 20 agents to follow 1 terrorist suspect. If there are 300 or 5000 or 20000 people of interest in our communities, our agents have to prioritise who to follow, clearly leaving potential huge risks to the British population of more attacks (5 successful attacks since March).
attributes.additional_details: The ordinary British public have had a enough of wishy washy handling of these attacks being told to carry on as normal. How can we? We need to see some action which provides this nation with security. If you can‚Äôt intern them due to political correctness then tag them.

attributes.action: Install security checkpoints at every underground transport station in the U.K.
attributes.background: Given the increasing prevalence of terror attacks in major U.K. cities, discuss reforms of national transport security policy. Initially install baggage scanners and metal detectors at underground stations and conduct random searches (not based on profile) of passengers crossing station checkpoints.
attributes.additional_details: Global cities more densely populated than London require passengers to place large items on scanners before proceeding to trains and metros. Metal detectors are also used to detect weapons and explosives. It is currently too easy to bring dangerous articles into confined stations in the U.K. wherein likelihood of injury and fatality from terror incidents increases. Requiring random searches of passengers and staff entering these stations could also mitigate the possibility of unfair profiling.

attributes.action: More funding towards cure research for Type 1 Diabetes
attributes.background: In June 2017 at the age of 18, I was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes. Beforehand I was perfectly healthy. I did nothing to cause this to come on, nor does anyone else suffering from this unfair disease.
attributes.additional_details: I'm requesting far more funding to go towards finding a cure for Type 1 Diabetes so that people who suffer from this unfair disease can have some hope.

attributes.action: Introduce a visa esta or esa system (like Canada/USA) for non-eu visitors to UK
attributes.background: Currently, USA, Canada and Australia require foreign visitors (including British people) to complete a visa entry application prior to travel. Anybody with a historical criminal record must apply for a police certificate and await clearance from those countries, before being allowed entry.
attributes.additional_details: Britons are being refused entry to Canada and Australia particularly, for historic criminal records - even childhood cautions and less serious records -such as drink driving twenty years ago. A similar system should exist in the UK to vet potential visitors from non-eu countries.

attributes.action: Make hoax callers to emergency services pay ¬£200 fine or a prison sentence
attributes.background: Over the past year, Wiltshire emergency services had over 1,000 hoax calls, and because they have a duty of care, they have to go to every call, so whilst there attending the hoax calls, there's hundreds of people that need an ambulance
attributes.additional_details: I believe, making sure every hoax call is investigated properly, there there should be a ¬£200 fine or a prison sentence,  and if it's a child doing it, then the parents should pay it, or the child do some kind of community service,

attributes.action: I would like to see it a legal requirement for cats to be microchipped
attributes.background: It would just make life alot simpler for vets & owners .If something happened to your cat at least you would know instead of forever hoping üò¢
attributes.additional_details: I run the group our pets uk and it's very sad the amount of cats that are killed in accidents , if they were microchipped owners would be notified .Cats do stray and would be easier to reunite with owners

attributes.action: Make all advertisers state if their images have been doctored.
attributes.background: Both France and Israel have made it law that advertisers must put on their packaging that their images have been doctored. This is to stop the presentation of false body image. Britain should follow in their example.
attributes.additional_details: Recently, there have been instances where celebrities such as Kate Winlslet have made it public that images of them have been doctored. It should not be up to the models and celebrities to state this. There are countless doctored images that the public aren't aware about, that are constantly thrown in our faces. Advertisers should clearly state that their images have been doctored, as this can give some people the need to get the perfect body, which is obviously made up by some advertisers.

attributes.action: To make a new Act of Parliament, namely, The Protection from Online Bullying Act
attributes.background:
Online Bullying has become very wide spread on social media and educational forums causing emotional and psychological suffering, and in some cases even suicide.  
It is not enough to report online bullying, the Search Engines need to be compelled to have sanctions in place to deter the bullies.
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is not an specific Act in place to compel online bullies to behave in a reasonable way, their behaviour causes damage to people's lives, and, there needs to be a law with sanctions to prevent this from happening.
Without a  law to deter cyber-bullying with sanctions, it will snowball out of control, as the evidence in the media indicates.

attributes.action: Companies must be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products
attributes.background: In my case, I have found that it is a common theme to find that "gelatine" is an ingredient to many confectionery items. This itself presents a grave concern, as I am a follower of the Islamic faith, who does not eat pork. Thus, failure to specify the type of gelatine is misleading.
attributes.additional_details: The rationale of ingredients being displayed on the back of food packaging is that we are in a position to exercise our autonomy. So, we can make an informed decision of whether or not it is something we wish to consume. This detail should be a basic requirement for all product packaging and be given the attention similar to allergy warnings. This applies to many sectors of society Muslims, Judaism, Hinduism, Sikhism and sects of Christianity. Therefore, essential in such a diverse society.

attributes.action: Fund free rail travel to school for children
attributes.background:
Kids travel free on buses and trams, but pay for rail.
Children should be encouraged to go by rail.
Roads would be less congested. Rail is safer.
They would be more likely to use rail when they grow up.
The UK Government should therefore fund free rail travel for school children.

attributes.action: Make targeted adverts in public spaces illegal.
attributes.background: The advertising billboards in Piccadilly Circus, for the first time ever, will show different adverts depending on what car you drive and how you look, by scrutinising you using cameras hidden in the screen.  This corporate assault on consensus reality has no place in our democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
References:

(1) https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23631483-400-giant-screen-in-piccadilly-circus-to-show-targeted-ads-based-on-cars/

(2)http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-4988764/New-screen-London-s-Piccadilly-Circus-track-people.html

(3)https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/personalised-ads-delivered-by-the-billboard-that-s-got-its-eye-on-you-hrxwrrb3z

(4) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telescreen

attributes.action: Commit to increasing the size of the Royal Navy by at least 20% over 50 years
attributes.background: Historically, the Royal Navy was the best in the world. Now, it's barely in the top ten. We need to be secure, it's not a luxury but a requirement. While the existing fleet is well equipped, there aren't enough ships to be everywhere needed. 20% in 50 years isn't a huge increase, but it's a start.
attributes.additional_details: The Royal Navy currently has under eighty commissioned ships. Only 3/4 of those are operational at any one time. These numbers are too small, especially compared to the 430 ships of the US Navy or the nearly 500 ships of China. In 1945 at the end of the Second World War, the Royal Navy had 900 ships, today's navy is less than 1% the size of then. We don't need to increase back to wartime levels, but we do need to increase the Navy's size considerably.

attributes.action: Increase the student loan repayment threshold for all graduates (Type 1 Loan)
attributes.background: Type 2 (Post sep 2012 students) student loans have recently had a threshold increase to ¬£25000. Now pre Sep 2012 starters pay 9% contributions on every single penny above ¬£17,775. If a grad from 2014 and 15 both earned 25k. Then the grad from 2014 would earn (Gross) ¬£650.25 less than the 2015 grad.
attributes.additional_details:
This could be the difference between being approved for a mortgage or refused. 

Considering only the top 23% of graduates pay their loans back within 30 years. We want the government to help all graduates and make the threshold for all student loans the same. 

It could be suggested its just another kick in the teeth for millennials who were born a decade late for affordable housing. 

https://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/family/2017/10/victory-for-graduates-student-loan-repayment-threshold

attributes.action: The history of Communism should be introduced into the GCSE history curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that communism is an important part of international history and will educate students of the united kingdom on the past and present.
attributes.additional_details: I have done a survey in my school which has shown that pupils have an interest in this subject and wish to learn more.

attributes.action: Remove MFL as a mandatory subject and allow students to chose if they take MFL
attributes.background: Plenty of students time is wasted learning a modern foreign language they have no interest in learning. Students should be allowed to pick if they take Modern Foreign Languages. Students should chose spend in a subject they have no interest in rather than wasting money and time of schools.

attributes.action: Stop ISP's from adding new customers in over utilised broadband areas.
attributes.background:
For 18 months my 200Mb service ran at 5Mb or less. Why, because my internet company continued to add new customers onto a network that was already at capacity. 

I would like Legislation creating to prevent this from happening.
attributes.additional_details:
Even though Ofcom said it would be 'unwise' of an ISP to do this, no action was taken and I suffered for a year and a half. I contacted my ISP's and they said that they were doing nothing wrong. 

My ISP later appeared on the BBC Watchdog show and the CEO admitted bad practice. 

Let's help make this bad practice illegal and an ISP subject to large fines when they continue to do it. Each time they add a new customer to an area like this it only compounds the problems to other existing customers.

attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Allow Cannabis Patches to be prescribed on the NHS for Chronic Pain conditions
attributes.background: Cannabis Patches should be prescribed on the NHS. It‚Äôs safer and cheaper than drugs currently used such as Morphine and Fentanyl.
attributes.additional_details:
I have many Chronic Pain conditions. I have been taking controlled drugs for over 12 years such as Morphine, Fentanyl, Oramorph and Tramadol ALL this could be avoided if I could have ONE Cannabis patch.  What I take is far more addictive and costs much more than a Cannabis Patch. It‚Äôs time we had Cannabis Patches made available on the NHS.
https://fibromyalgianewstoday.com/2017/06/23/first-cannabinoid-based-patch-for-fibromyalgia-other-chronic-pain-is-ready-for-release/

attributes.action: Introduce 19 baby check questions in to prenatal & postnatal information given
attributes.background: 19 baby check questions may help identify if a baby has Sudden Infant Death Syndrome (SIDS) risk. Should be included in prenatal & postnatal information from midwifes & health visitor. You are given leaflet about enviromental factors. Check List only available from charity which supports after SIDS.
attributes.additional_details: Studies show 19 question scored checklist may determine which babies are at risk of SIDS. It is based on many symptoms & signs that are not significant individually, but taken together may signify a risk of death. The Baby Check as a means of quantifying acute illness, can be used by parents to help them decide whether to seek medical attention. It can be used by health professionals as a tool to discriminate between those babies who should be assessed in hospital and those who need not be.

attributes.action: Stop UK foreign aid to all countries that mistreat minorities in appalling ways.
attributes.background:
Spending of foreign aid has to be used to the benefit of all citizens. Countries, such as Pakistan, that continue to mistreat their minorities must not receive aid any longer: 
Asia Bibi, Christian mother of five, in prison for alleged blasphemy since 2010. 
Ahmadi mosque attacked, Chakwal, 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
References:
Asia Bibi:
bbc.co.uk/news/world-asia-38222680
Ahmadi mosque attack:
dw.com/en/the-persecution-of-ahmadis-in-pakistan-and-beyond/a-36748924
More examples:
Pakistani Christian school-boy beaten to death by Muslim classmates; Death sentence for Christian accused of WhatsApp ‚Äúblasphemy‚Äù:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#pakistan
Indian Church,Bibles torched in attack:
barnabasfund.org/Prayer/Prayer-Focus-1017#india
Afghan ex-Muslim persecuted:
youtube.com/watch?v=Tr_VGtTV8yY

attributes.action: Ban all trade of Ivory in the UK with NO exceptions!
attributes.background: Elephants‚Äô biggest threat is the trade in their ivory tusks. The UK has become the world‚Äôs leading exporter in ivory in recent years. The newly proposed ban contains exceptions, including musical Instruments and items of "cultural importance". The ban should be TOTAL, with no exceptions.
attributes.additional_details: For more information search for "The Truth Behind Your Ivory Trinkets" on YouTube. This video shows the brutal process by which ivory is harvested and contains more information about the ivory trade. Please watch.

attributes.action: Fund a campaign promoting hemp farming + the use of biodegradable hemp packaging
attributes.background: For those of you that don't know hemp farming in the UK is legal under licence, thus making hemp products legal, hemp plastic is 100% biodegradable, when exposed to the elements and has a long lasting in shop on shelf lifespan, normal plastic even when broken down never really goes away.
attributes.additional_details: Normal plastic when broken down to micro fragments often ends up in the ocean being eaten by krill and other sea creatures working it's way up the food chain, every year it's estimated we (humans) eat 11000 micro fragments of plastic every year coming from seafood, plastic is in our food chain this needs to change. We absorb fewer than 1% but they will still accumulate in the body over time Let's stop killing our oceans Hemp has an endless amount of uses Fuel building Materials, so much more.

attributes.action: Ban video games that promote violence and sexual abuse.
attributes.background: I would like the UK Government to change the laws on video games which normalise gun violence, prostitution, rape etc. There are children as young as 7 playing these games online without their parents knowing. This is not something that should be acceptable, full stop.
attributes.additional_details: Why should these games showing guns, sex, prostitution, gangs and so on be available to children when violence, acid attacks, rape and murders are happening in our country?

attributes.action: Ban cyclists from riding two abreast.
attributes.background: Driving through the Yorkshire Dales is quite a frustrating experience - driving behind 20 cyclists for miles with about 50 cars trying to pass. Impossible.

attributes.action: Stop councils charging for DIY waste at recycling sites.
attributes.background: The relevant government department has stated that these charges should not be imposed. Any discouragement to the proper disposal of DIY waste will contribute to the increase in fly tipping.

attributes.action: Include the Welsh dragon onto the Union Jack.
attributes.background: For centuries Wales has been brutally ignored from our nation's flag. We with a voice must feel empowered to speak up against this disgrace. In November 2007 the House of Commons discussed this however no follow up action has been executed. We must take action and be proud of our heritage!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-25222891 Here is a fantastic list of examples of how the UK should represent the beautiful country of Wales. 
IMG_7543.JPG

attributes.action: Make it Legal where ‚ÄòFootballs‚Äô are Being Kicked into Gardens can be Kept in Law
attributes.background: At this time the Law states that Balls must be returned which is Stupid as they just Repeat their actions causing Damage to Plants and Property, they never Learn but the Loss would stop there actions, this can be from the Highway as Well as joining Gardens, there are Play Areas made for Football.
attributes.additional_details: The Police fail to uphold the Law from the Highways using section 161 item 3, Parents and their Children need to Learn either the easy way which they control or the hard way where they loose the Balls, we have had over Fifty balls over now with Nobody doing anything, cars damaged and garden lights smashed, the wife being hit in the face plus many other Antisocial things, the Police should not take their side and threaten Prosecution if house owners keep the Balls, Let‚Äôs put the issue correct Now

attributes.action: Stop charging married women to have their surname changed on their passport
attributes.background: When people get married and wish to take their partners surname the UK government charges to have their surname changed. This discriminates against marriage and women in particular as it is normally this sex which takes the surname of their partner. The charge should be eliminated or greatly reduced

attributes.action: Abolish the annual Rod Licence for anglers in England and Wales
attributes.background: More than a million freshwater anglers in England and Wales (not Scotland) pay an annual fee for a (fishing) Rod Licence. This is a tax on angling. Yet there is no licence needed to walk the same river, nor to visit our National Parks, nor to climb a mountain or bicycle on our roads.
attributes.additional_details: Income from licences is falling. Between 2010 and 2016 a drop of 12.6%. Income down from ¬£25.4m to ¬£22.2m. Dr. Broughton at the ATA has collated data over the last six years. ‚Ä¢You don't need a licence in Scotland or for sea fishing. ‚Ä¢It is unfair anglers have to buy a licence to enjoy a legal hobby when no others who make an equal claim on natural resources do ‚Ä¢Anglers spend ¬£1.2bn annually; that is ¬£240m in VAT income alone. Abolition is likely to see participation increase

attributes.action: Enforce a maximum limit on vehicle insurance prices for young people.
attributes.background: Insurance prices in this modern day are through the roof. And its even worse for young drivers. I know there is more of a chance of us crashing due to lack of experience however we still need to get to work and function as a part of society.
attributes.additional_details: My first year car insurance was ¬£1600 on a Ford Ka. Paid in monthly instalments. Unfortunately I crashed in my first year due to a spillage on the road during a wet day. Unavoidable. I was following the speed limit, no one else was involved. But my insurance is due to rise to upwards of ¬£3000 in January. I am 19 and well paid for my age but still this is going to be a struggle. I know many people who also struggle with this however first year drivers older than 24 pay less, how does that work?

attributes.action: Stop cyclists from using mobile phones and headphones whilst in motion.
attributes.background: As a cyclist myself, it irritates me when I see other bike riders giving the rest of us a bad reputation by using mobile phones or listening to music on headphones whilst in motion. And don't get me started on ignoring traffic lights! The rules of the road need to be enforced.

attributes.action: Make access to food, clothes and shelter a human right, enshrined in law.
attributes.background: Poverty is a very real phenomonon for many in the UK today and the inequality gap between the rich and the poor continues to widen. Lets underline the boundaries of our civilisation. Too many people will sleep in the street this winter. Lets end homelessness and hunger in the UK, 1 meal at a time.
attributes.additional_details: I am a citizen, with a voice and a computer.  I just can't continue to pass the increasing number of people on the street and try to give them change for a cup of tea without recognising that the problem needs to be tackled strategically/politically.  I also worked as a health visitor and saw first hand how many families don,t have consistent access to meals.  The problem is huge and needs a strategic response at a national level.  Food, clothes and shelter for all is not too much to ask.

attributes.action: Working week to be split 40/60, weekend (Fri-Sun) weekday (Mon-Thurs)
attributes.background: I believe this should be considered with great thought as I think we over work ourseleves during the week and dont get enough breathing space to enjoy our own time and time with our familes, overworking can lead to mental and physical health issues so I believe this can help fix that.

attributes.action: Re-open the Dubs scheme to allow unaccompanied child refugees entry into the UK
attributes.background: The Government announced in February that it would close the Dubs scheme ‚Äì intended to grant 3000 vulnerable unaccompanied minors a safe passage to Britain ‚Äì after accepting just 350. We are capable of taking thousands more. Sign to call for the scheme to be reopened & help these desperate children.
attributes.additional_details: FOI requests have shown that local councils have voluntarily offered to accept 1572 more children than are currently being supported, yet the Government is refusing to accept any more child refugees from the continent. The longer this goes on the more likely it is that children will go missing & fall into the hands of traffickers. Our values of openness & tolerance mean that we have a duty to be a land of sanctuary to these vulnerable children. The Government must act now and re-open the scheme.

attributes.action: Stop companies asking for payment details for free trials of services.
attributes.background: For Free trials of services companies request payment details for the said trials. Failure to terminate at the end of a trial would normal mean services are charged for the next billing period. They should provide a option to terminate at point of  registering for free trail or terminate at expiry
attributes.additional_details:
Netflix
Linked in 
NOW TV  and so many more
They are all are relying on some income from those that forget to terminate. A free trial in good faith would not require payment method. It should be illegal not to auto terminate or give the option to terminate at the point of registering

attributes.action: Make more council houses and flats
attributes.background: There are to many family's and single people suffering about not having homes we need to make sure that nobody should be homeless in this day and age families or people should feel safe
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken to people living on the streets also have seen to many programmes on this subject the government needs to take action

attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: Amend building regulations to ban use of wooden/ laminate flooring in flats.
attributes.background:
Wooden and laminate floors in non-ground floor flats can make life very difficult for people living in flats below. The noise can be unbearable. 

Building regulations should be amended to ban the use of such flooring in non-ground floor flats.

attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Prescribe dance fitness classes on the NHS for everyone's good health
attributes.background: Classes like Zumba should be free and prescribed to everyone on the NHS as they provide multiple health benefits including losing weight and has been known to fight depression.
